qas.question: What is the largest ethnic group in Pakistan?
What minimum percent of each Punjab district speaks Punjabi natively?
What language has official recognition in Punjab?
Punjabi is the mother-tongue of less than what percentage of the population?
Urdu is the major language for what province?
What is the standard form of Urdu?
What is primarily divided by social stratifications?

context: The major and native language spoken in the <b7_0>Punjab<b7_0/> is <a0_0>Punjabi<a0_0/> (which is written <a1_0>in a Shahmukhi script<a1_0/> in Pakistan) and <a2_0>Punjabis<a2_0/> comprise the largest ethnic group in country. Punjabi is the provincial language of Punjab. There is not a single district in the province where <b5_0>Punjabi<b5_0/> language is mother-tongue of less than <a3_0><b6_0>89%<b6_0/><a3_0/> of population. The language is not given any official recognition in the Constitution of Pakistan at the national level. Punjabis themselves are a heterogeneous group comprising different tribes, clans (Urdu: برادری‎) and communities. In Pakistani Punjab these <b9_0>tribes<b9_0/> have more to do with traditional occupations such as blacksmiths or artisans as opposed to rigid social stratifications. Punjabi dialects spoken in the province include <b8_0>Majhi<b8_0/> (Standard), Saraiki and Hindko. Saraiki is mostly spoken in <a4_0>south Punjab<a4_0/>, and Pashto, spoken in some parts of north west Punjab, especially in Attock District and Mianwali District.
